website_summaries.verdict: Safety is an important consideration with water bottle launchers, and the Aquapod includes a pressure safety valve to prevent overinflation. One-piece launcher is very portable, may need additional bracing during use.
pros: Bottle rockets with optional fins can reach incredible heights
Accurate air pressure valve provides scientific data
cons: Does not work well with all sizes and brands of soda bottles
Launch mechanism can jam, requiring manual release
Safety valve can leak under low PSI conditions

customer_reviews.title: Adults had fun too lol
customer_reviews.text: Was worth the money for the fun the kids had with it the first day. We used a small air compressor to fill it up rather then a bike pump. Doesn't take much air to send this thing higher then the trees. Comes with a long pull cord to launch the plastic bottle into the air , the kids had a blast changing the water levels to see whose would go higher.
customer_reviews.author: nic

customer_reviews.title: Best Launcher
customer_reviews.text: Used this at a recent cub scout event and they loved it. I had my concern that the plastic release lever would be broken by the boys but it held up well even when they really yanked on the string. One Note of Caution: this needs to be used on a level service, if the ground is not level, then use some wood to level the launcher. All its vital that you use the U-clips to secure the launcher to the ground. Finally don't forget to lubricate the o-ring that seals against the bottle. I used a compressor at 30 PSI setting to charge the launcher, the compressor was tremendous time savor.
customer_reviews.author: Leaton

customer_reviews.title: It works and is entertaining but does not achieve the advertised performance.
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked as per the users instructions except the pressure release valve triggered at 32 psi instead of the 40 psi discussed in the user instructions. We were able to get about 40 ft of altitude instead of the advertised 100. My granddaughter was still thrilled by the device. I am not sure how durable the plastic parts will be but there have been no problems through 10 launches. I am experimenting with the amount of water in the bottle to see if I can get more altitude with the lower pressure. The recommended one-third bottle full of water is just too much. One-quarter, or perhaps less, seems to work better at the lower pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment and learning for all ages:
customer_reviews.text: My children had a blast with this. It was the perfect pick me up for this Covid-19 lock down. I have three kids, ages 12-17. Even the neighbors all stepped out to watch and enjoy our fun. I let my 14 year old set it up, and he didn’t understand the pull string, but I saw it and once we put that on, I felt much more at ease watching them blast off. It was tons of smiles for sure. I highly recommend this! (Plus we talked about physics and PSI. Bonus!)
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Just plain fun
customer_reviews.text: Easy for kids 5 and up to do themselves (with adult supervision) 8 and up no problems. Durable , spare o/rings included. Tying on some colored flagging tape or an army man parachute makes additional fun or glow sticks at night. Kept the little ones safely occupied July 4 and easy to take to a park. Would buy again, one product improvement would be a guideline eyelet to keep the trigger line intuitively straight, but just a thought, not really needed, I really like the high pressure safety blow off valve. We bought the recommended tire pump, it works very smoothly, but most would work I suppose,
customer_reviews.author: Survivalnut

customer_reviews.title: Get it. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the money. I bought it for my older five kids. They have fun. We bought it on our family reunion. The kids have a cousin who is an engineer. He loved it. He's 25. They kids had a blast creating the perfect liter bottle with wings, streamers, a pointed nose from another liter bottle. This rocket shot so far up into the sky. Over and over. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 8

customer_reviews.title: We have lift off!
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Well designed. Fun stickers to make it look like a launch pad. The bottles really take off. Best to film in slo-motion with your phone to see the water trail. They sell fins to put on your water bottles which I suspect makes them fly even better. I lost the spare O-rings and will try to contact the company to see if they will send me some more.
customer_reviews.author: The Design Critic

customer_reviews.title: Science Olympiad Club
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Science Olympiad Club so that they could test their bottle rocket this year. Unfortunately, the kids were only supposed to build their rockets with 1-liter bottles. This rocket launcher is for 2-liter bottles. When I tested it with 2-liter bottles, it worked well. Was a little apprehensive using it with the 1-liter bottle. I do feel the hook to keep the launcher in the ground may not be strong enough to do this. With just our little practice, the launcher rose and left the ground during a practice launch.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say we were let down by the performance ...
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say we were let down by the performance of our bottle luncher. It came when it said it would, it was brand new and appears to be in perfect shape, assembles easily enough. When it came to launch...nada. nothing happened we tried MULTIPLE times to get it to work as advertised but it didn't deliver at all. We finally got it to launch twice nd then nothing again. We are sad to return this item but better luck on our next luncher.
customer_reviews.author: Genie Christensen

customer_reviews.title: No pressure = No launch
customer_reviews.text: I have taught summer camps with water rockets for years. This year I teamed up with another experienced teacher. We decided to use this rather than build one of our own. Well, it released pressure before it would even launch the bottle. Luckily there is an easy diy plan from NASA that results in a launch every time with just a few pumps from a bicycle pump.
customer_reviews.author: R_U_U

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: This water rocket is awesome, took me about 4mins to setup, like the extra o rings, and the pop off value is a nice touch so the bottle doesn’t explode while you are pumping next to it, so awesome when it shoots up, had a blast with my kids, definitely use your slo-mo video setting, definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for what you need!
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for my 7th grade rocket unit! Everything was well explained, the product worked fine and we had a blast! (pun intended) The only aspect I wish could change is the ability to safely launch at an angle, instead of only upwards. I needed to order a launcher in a pinch, and set sites on the Aquapod. You may be able to prop the legs up at a slight angle in order to get some distance, but it does not seem to be very stable when done that way. Overall, no complaints! Just an area of improvement after having the launcher. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Aangst

customer_reviews.title: Works good on larger bottles.
customer_reviews.text: Our Cub Scout pack got these for the recruitment drive and a case of small water bottles from the local store. The small bottles don't have a long enough neck to get a consistent seal. 1 liter or 2 liter bottles work fantastic! It would be nice if the MAX PRESSURE was printed on the unit itself. Small bottles grow at 50 lbs, I didn't try any higher but could have easily blew them up. Not the unit's fault, but a max pressure warning on the unit could not be found.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory E Brunelle

customer_reviews.title: Can't get pressure above 20 psi
customer_reviews.text: First, the back "foot" that you need to assemble was another front foot; totally wrong shape. But more important, we couldn't pump pressure past 20 psi because the pressue releif valve. Good design, but bad execution. Bought a second one, got the correct back foot but could only get 40 psi. Better, but not what's advertized. Really bummed out about this. we've used other launchers (not this brand) that worked great. Not so with this one (two).
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool! like another reviewer said i used silicone grease on the o-ring and the bottle launched atleast 75 ft. I bought this for my 8 year old son and after an hour he was pumping it up and setting it off himself. Im a happy dad. Great toy
customer_reviews.author: Adam applegate

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for all
customer_reviews.text: My dad an I used to build these in the past when he was still teaching, must say this works far better and easier. I've been using a 1.5 liter water bottle and strato fins with an air bubble to pressurize the launcher, which works awesomely. Got well over a dozen launches without having to hand pump. I recommend using something to lube the o-ring on the launcher so that bottle doesn't get stuck. A little cooking spray or something similar works well and only has to be done once. About 1/3 to 1/2 full of water seems to get the best height, but takes more air.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Walt

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun
customer_reviews.text: This product is so much fun. I did have to devise a different way to keep it sturdy in the ground when kids pull the string. The flimsy metal U does not work well. Tent stakes and bungee cord did the trick. Otherwise, a fun product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issue.
customer_reviews.text: A decent product but... didn't open the box for nearly 2 monts until last weekend (Mother's Day). Unfortunately after taking the product out of the box I noticed that all three black feet supports are identical. They would fit the two sides but will not fitt the one below air valve. So, I had to come out with a piece of wood to level the launcher on the grass. Otherwise it would shoot the rockets at a certain angle. Bad quality control. Can no longer return or replace.
customer_reviews.author: Xevier69

customer_reviews.title: The Bottles will soar
customer_reviews.text: We approached Coca Cola and they sent us free bottles to use with this device. The launcher worked so well that we had to limit the pressure so that it would not go too far. It is easy to control and is loads of fun with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an experiment/activity for my math class as we learned about parabolas. Seriously, the best unit I have done so far. Soooo much fun! The launcher is easy and seems pretty darn safe. Only frustration was that sometimes the O-rings seemed to give and needed to be changed quicker than I would like. You would pump up the soda bottle and it would slowly inch off the launcher. A little scary! But with fresh O-rings, it works awesome! Suggestion: Decorate and design your rocket for aerodynamics!
customer_reviews.author: sayra

customer_reviews.title: Better than the DIY
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! We have the homemade version and weren't sure if we wanted to spend the money for a commercial version. The parts are relatively cheap for the homemade version. But we are glad we purchased this. The homemade version is difficult to perfect and there is an awful lot of "fixing" in between launches. This product worked great right out of the bag. The kids set it up and let the bottles fly. It worked with multiple different kinds of 2 liter soda bottles. The only concern is that the O ring already installed on the device was pretty worn out and brittle, but fortunately it came with 3 spares so we just switched it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had a blast(off)
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews good and bad. And it clearly states in the manual to oil o-ring. Not 1 failure to launch. Kids loved it as did I. Simple concept, great design
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WAY TO INTRODUCE ROCKETRY
customer_reviews.text: This set up works really well. Buy a cheap bicycle pump for $12 and you are in business. My grand kids love it and I have given it to my nephews who have already put a 2 liter bottle completely over their house.
customer_reviews.author: Bret D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: 2 liter bottle launcher
customer_reviews.text: Great fun. Could be a bit cheaper for what it is, but worth the price in fun.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves playing with this in the yard. Only complaint is the O ring that seals the bottle likes to slide down so it has to be reset each time. Not a big deal but dont forget otherwise all the water will just run out. Again, not a big deal just a observation.
customer_reviews.author: Ned D.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great, the first 2 times but then the regulator broke and we were unable repair it. I had 30 very disappointed scouts wanting to do this, but didn’t get the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: great afternoon family fun.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a birthday present for a 8.year.old boy. He and his mom had a great time. Only use the 2 Liter bottles. Easy for them to go 100 feet in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Line

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun with kids
customer_reviews.text: This is lots of fun with kids and adults. The only problem is that you can't take it apart to put it back in the box. well you can, but you'll break it like i did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Educational
customer_reviews.text: Lots of summer fun and educational. From what I see so far, the heavy duty construction will not let it break easily. It's built for the long run, not to last a couple of times and then into the trash like so many other things I've seen lately. I imagine some kids might get bored pretty quickly, but my grandson has had a blast trying different scenarios to get the highest altitude or accuracy. Paining designs on the bottles and making/gluing fins on them has kept him busy and entertained as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great kid gift
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Hours of entertainment. We experiment with filling bottles with various amounts of soda to see how high we can get them. My toddler loves this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Le

customer_reviews.title: Could be a Tad Dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Man, the concept of this thing is amazing. It would have worked great if we could have stabilized it so that when we pulled the string the whole base didn't come up. With the base lifting, the product becomes dangerous cause the rocket can release in your direction.
customer_reviews.author: Kauai Mama

customer_reviews.title: Need to rethink about getting this product.. Great idea of how it works
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea for for this unfortunately when we got our stuff it had three legs and only two of them fit so we had to return it and thank God they took it back but I don't think I'd ordered this again
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Herrick

customer_reviews.title: Just read the instructions!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of fun if you follow the instructions. Always supervised your child, 50psi is a lot of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Fun product, poor control component
customer_reviews.text: Nice product worked great and was lots of fun, but the pressure relief valve failed after being over pressuring 3 times. Sadly it only worked for about 20 launches. I’m currently looking for a replacement or plug and gauge setup to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason York

customer_reviews.title: Really Really Ridiculously Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm supposed to use this to demonstrate the usefulness of air and water pressure to a group of 50 elementary students TOMORROW! The package arrived today and when I attempted to test the product, I found that it could not hold pressure. After taking the whole thing apart, I found the leak in a seam where two of the internal PVC pieces connect. I have attempted to re-epoxy the seam to make the device hold pressure but will have to wait until it dries to know for sure. I'm very disappointed that an off-the-shelf product has turned into a DIY project for me.
customer_reviews.author: Grady P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bottle Launcher!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my daughter's 8th birthday party and were not disappointed! The launcher held up to a lot of use and performed wonderfully. Every child was able to launch their bottle more than once with consistent and reliable results. All the children, including the 3 year olds, were able to pull the string to launch their bottle. The launcher worked every time and we look forward to using it again!
customer_reviews.author: Brian R Toole

customer_reviews.title: Much better than building your own!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! This thing will launch your water rockets a thousand feet in the air. Well, that's how high the kids thought it went. ;oP Design is great, as long as you get the brace into the ground to keep it from tipping over. I ended up holding it when we launched, but at 100 degrees in Texas in August, that was MY favorite part!! I also bought the red screw on fins, and I will buy several more of those!! They are AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but make sure you have an equally good bicycle pump!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle launcher after failing to build my own :) It's nicely built and worked well, though the bike pump we used initially didn't provide enough pressure. We ran to the store and bought a pump with a PSI gauge and it worked as expected. We pumped it to about 80 psi before the overflow valve kicked in. Ironically enough we discovered that the bottles will launch better with no water at all :) Also, keep in mind that this doesn't come in a box, so if it's a gift, you should use the shipping box or be prepared with some other way to wrap it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bouillon

customer_reviews.title: Could not get to launch without pushing it off by hand
customer_reviews.text: The bottle will not release from the o-ring. I have pumped it to right at the 50 psi rating before the pressure release valve trips. The only way I could get it to launch was to push it off by hand. Also, the balloons that come with it break as soon as you start filling them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy but a part was missing!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son’s 8th birthday and it has a part that did not fit. My husband was able to rig it where he could play with it but for $40.00 you’d think it would come with all the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Harris

customer_reviews.title: A great family toy!
customer_reviews.text: This was such a fun toy at the family reunion! Parachute and stabilizing paddles were definitely a good additional purchase. Worth every penny! Super fun!!
customer_reviews.author: a.mecham

customer_reviews.title: Great hight, no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product. My kids love pulling the cord and then trying to catch the bottle as it falls. Has great hight and little issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brhyde

customer_reviews.title: Good, clean fun
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great and is a lot of fun! I gave it to my 13-year-old nephew for his birthday, and he's having a lot of fun with it. It is pretty cool how high this shoots the bottle. He has yet to do any modifications of the bottle when shooting it up in the air, so I'm sure there is more fun to be had.
customer_reviews.author: Iamme

customer_reviews.title: Failed on the first use.
customer_reviews.text: The check valve held very little pressure before allowing the water to force it's way into my bicycle tire pump. There are no directions indicating what pressure is necessary or will cause failure. On a second attempt, I used less pressure and it wasn't enough to force the bottle off of the nozzle. I took the loss and made a better one with PVC for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Tons of fun. Easy to use. No assembly. Well built and has endured hours of "launches" You really must use the small metal stake to hold it in the ground or the launcher can fall over at the worst time. This happened once to us (and I just saw an identical outcome on AFV!) before I read the instructions and figured out what the clip was for. Would highly recommend for devious grandparents helping grandchildren misbehave!!
customer_reviews.author: Arrow

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my son, and everytime we go to the park, we have 20 kids all watching us shoot this up in the sky, really fun for all including me a an old man (dad).. We love it so much I have bought 6 for birthdays presents! Everybody loves them... The only complaint I have, is that that since I buy these for birthday presents the packaging is not good, just a plastic bag. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rockets away
customer_reviews.text: Was building one out of PEX for savings & after all said & done, cheaper as well as easier & definitely more effective to purchase this launcher so that’s what I did.
customer_reviews.author: Roland M Samples

customer_reviews.title: i hate to bash without recommending another product the one my ...
customer_reviews.text: i hate to bash without recommending another product the one my kid's school uses is great. this one is just plain garbage works about 30% of the time and yes i lubricated the O ring bottle does not release any other products folks recommend ???
customer_reviews.author: few words in florida

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: The children love launching bottle rockets. They play for hours and never get bored. The air valve is a little touchy and must be tightened regularly and is a little hard to access but well worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and a “blast” for any age!
customer_reviews.text: Its a very well built product. Bought it for activity for my grandchildren. It could be used for a science experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This product is so fun! Great STEM activity for hands on learning
customer_reviews.text: This product is so fun! Great STEM activity for hands on learning. I'm a third grade teacher and do this project with my class every year! I teach a lot of physics to my students without them even knowing it! The launcher is well made and very durable. I have actually had other launchers that didn't work nearly as good as this one. I highly recommend this as a super fun science activity. Just be careful as the bottle actually flies pretty high if you add ballist and fins and can come down pretty fast around excited youngsters.
customer_reviews.author: Hanaleisurf

customer_reviews.title: Super well built
customer_reviews.text: Super well built, and super fun! Get the fins for $8. and watch it go even higher. We put it out on our dock at the lake and pumped it up with a bike pump with a pressure gauge. The gauge said 100+ lbs of pressure and off it went. The first time you do it, it will not go as high.. next time.. BOOM! We had an issue pulling the string and the entire unit would slide back. Make sure you anchor to something so it doesnt tip over when you pull the string. Go get it!
customer_reviews.author: thedubc

customer_reviews.title: No longer reliable
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. I have used a version of this in the past that worked well, and after it broke after 2 years of class projects, I decided to try to replace it. I bought two of these and they both completely failed the first time I tried to use them in my class. The pressure release leaked almost instantly after starting to pressurize. These used to be good quality, not anymore. Maybe others had good luck, but it did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: The pressure relief valve broke within a month of buying. Now it doesn’t build or hold pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It is fun. Used a bottle but seemed not to fit
customer_reviews.text: It is fun. Used a bottle but seemed not to fit. I had to manually help it launch. Yes. I actually got down and had to push the bottle up so that it could launch. The the safest since the idea is that this lifts off like a rocket. Unless you find the right bottle, don't expect this to launch with the pull string. You get the right bottle than it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Weight down the far end!
customer_reviews.text: Important... If you do not want it tip towards you and send the rocket hurtling at high speeds towards the child, ANCHOR the far end down with a 22 pack of water bottles or something else that is heavy! Otherwise, these are great! The children love to launch 2 liter water bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool, just wish it held more pressure
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool, just wish it held more pressure! It advertises launching just the bottles alone, but that sucks.The bottles flip around and don't go high. That is ok because I built my own bottle rocket. You just have to add fins and put weight on top of the bottle and this thing will launch it a couple hundred feet into the air!
customer_reviews.author: A97531

customer_reviews.title: Luckily any bike pump seems to work just fine. I suggest you get one that can tell ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a project for my students, worked very well however very flimsy and no pump. Luckily any bike pump seems to work just fine. I suggest you get one that can tell you the pressure because you want to be able to control that for launches and experimenting.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I would recomend adding vaseline to the launch ring to extend the life of each ring. I have launched it over 20 times and it worked great every time!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail M.

customer_reviews.title: Wow so cool
customer_reviews.text: I love it my Grandkids love seeing the rabbit just showed up in the air
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Worman

customer_reviews.title: Terrific toy
customer_reviews.text: We really like this. We now buy two liters to keep the kids supplied with new rockets. Very durable and not problems yet. I did follow the suggestions from other raters to put oil on the " o " ring. I just use motor oil. This thing is a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: It does not come as one piece and I think this causes air to leak.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second aquapod I have purchased the first one was puchased about 7 years ago and has worked great until last year when it started to crack. (I teach middle school science). I was so excited to find a replacement but was very displeased that it was no longer sold as one piece and then when we went to use it in class the release lever does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Air compressor needed!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. An air compressor definitely makes it a lot more fun, and faster!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed as it was fun while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It only worked a few times, then stopped working and the return window has already closed. Disappointed as it was fun while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Piper Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Beginners toy
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, was tad bit bummed that it didn’t go as high as told
customer_reviews.author: Spartan78

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We first saw this at a scouting event and decided to buy one for our son. He loves it and the neighborhood kids all swarm around when we get it out. It's made well and should last for a long time! Keep 2 liter bottles on hand so you don't have to refill after every shot!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K.

customer_reviews.title: Adult use only!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew. It is definitely geared for adults! Was difficult to use and blew up in my adult sons face several times. Definitely use carefully!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: not recommended
customer_reviews.text: did not work. More than that, when I pull the rope the bottle did not got out so I keep doing that and it fall down while the bottle was at the direction of my child!!. At this time I was glad It did not work. dangerous. Send it back
customer_reviews.author: yaniv

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Ment to post earlier... When product was delivered it was missing a few items such as the string and U bracket (U bracket is not in the photos but is supposed to be part of the package). Contacted Aquapod directly via email (got a response in minutes which is amazing). They requested my address along with seller information to fix the problem. 5 stars just for customer service. As for the product my son (7 year old) has a great time using it, so do I.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding toy
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. We had so much fun with this. The adults would set it up. The kids would pull the cord, then the chase was on to catch it in the air. It shot way up high: well over our 2-story house. Watch the wind, because it'll sail. Also, fill with the recommended 1/3 full water; that's the optimum ratio. We, adults, had almost more fun than the kids.
customer_reviews.author: FrBrass

customer_reviews.title: fun for the family
customer_reviews.text: Fun for the family! Must buy a bike pump with it for it to work! worth it! so much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hill

customer_reviews.title: smart design, well constructed
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the heavier duty devices I have seen on the market. It works really well. Simple design, smart design, well constructed. I bought the accessories- parachutes, fins for the water bottles and going to try them out.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great activity to spend time with a child
customer_reviews.text: This toy is blast your children will absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 6th grade physical science class. We designed our rockets and the launcher will not work. It will not build pressure in the bottle and it leaks water everywhere. I am now stuck with 120 bottles and some very disappointed kids.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Effective for experiments but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a science teacher and has bought several of these. They work for his experiments, but I'm only giving it four stars because although they work, his students keep breaking them, which is why he has to keep buying them. They're not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED. I bought this for my son's science project ...
customer_reviews.text: DISAPPOINTED. I bought this for my son's science project and it failed to deliver. Bottles require assist to release otherwise NADA. I feel like I wasted my money and both my son and I were so excited when the box arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Lukasiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Updated review...it works
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this product a failing grade. After finding out that my bike pump was the issue I tried again. With just two pumps I got 30 feet. We are going to have a Christmas break rocket build off.
customer_reviews.author: Lilcombatboots

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My students had so much fun shooting off bottle rockets. Worked great. Pressure saftey valve is kind of sensitive though
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Fun product
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok, not super durable but will last with a little care
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Velez

customer_reviews.title: Fun and impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous! It works reliably and quickly. We used a plug in air compressor, 2l bottle,. 33 fill water, and tested with and without fins. Without fins, the bottle went over 2 stories high but tumbled end over end. With fins, it went. 33 to. 5 higher with no tumbling. It is really impressive. You have to have the unit set as level as possible. Loads of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Meg Mitcham

customer_reviews.title: Rockets rock!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a science teacher and used the bottle launcher for experiments with 7th and 8th grades. They varied the amount of water and air pressure, and built nose cones and fins onto their soda bottles. They had a great time, the launcher works very well and is easy to use, and it's safe when used per the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Old Shep

customer_reviews.title: Super fun,  super simple!
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use!!! Launched about 20 rockets one after the other!!! The string did break at one point, but was an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves it
customer_reviews.text: This product surprised me. It works better than advertised. My son and grandson were surprised at how high the bottles would fly. They were also nice enough to include several extra "O" rings, a must have, So far the "O" rings seem to be the only thing that wears out. This little rocket launcher is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kids love this thing. Really, other reviews have said everything better. Great little toy.
customer_reviews.author: KrysTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME rocket launcher
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME rocket launcher. This is completely stable if you stake it into the ground like you're supposed to, and the launch mechanism is easier than other types of bottle rocket launchers I've used. The 50 PSI max probably keeps it from being as powerful as higher end models, but for the money, I think this launcher is the way to go in science class settings.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Backus

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stronger spring (aftermarket) to make it worthwhile
customer_reviews.text: It's better than nothing, but the spring mechanism that holds the rocket down is way too weak. We tried for about an hour and never got a "proper" launch sequence to work, despite not even pumping up to the recommended pressure in the provided documentation. A quick trip to the hardware store to replace the spring would turn this into a great product.
customer_reviews.author: James Mason

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. Broke first time we used it! Got to maybe 25 psi (0n great Bontrager bike pump) and seams in plastic ruptured on both side of main chamber. Needed this for my son's science expert proving F = M x A, and now I'm trying to super glue / duct tape it together to get experiment done. Pressure release valve was supposed to open over 50 psi, and this thing breaks at 25. Trash!
customer_reviews.author: R. Simonds

customer_reviews.title: Good clean wet fun
customer_reviews.text: Tons of fun. For quicker action I suggest hanging on to a few bottles, setting it up near a hose to fill them. I then set my small compressor's regulator to 50PSI and use a trigger fill (with gauge) attachment to pump air in quickly. Can't stress the importance of some soap or lube on the O ring, other than that my own and the neighborhood kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Fun, Fun!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's 11th birthday gift. He thought it was the coolest gift ever! He loved it!!!! It worked great, the bottle went very high, and he loved experimenting with varying amounts of water. He even had great success without any water (just air pressure). It comes with a horseshoe shaped wire that anchors it to the ground (great added safety feature). I would highly recommend this......even dads will like this!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Using this for a summer program. We had to watch a youtube video to figure out some basics. Launched great 6 times, then stopped working. So very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ojo

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it has all its parts.
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts when it arrived the children were very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: My nephew's son is out of intensive care after having ...
customer_reviews.text: My nephew's son is out of intensive care after having removed most of the bottle parts from his medulla oblongata!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: One of the best on the market. Just add a pump and a soda bottle (I prefer a 500 mL bottle).
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Toddler friendly
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old can do it by herself and loves it
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Get a good pump
customer_reviews.text: Very fun and easy to use, just make sure you have a good pump
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for our 11 year old son. Very fun and amusing for all. Please exercise caution as the pressure could build up and hit a child in the face if they are unaware of how close they are when pumping and playing. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: lil' shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: JUNK! The launcher wouldn’t hold more then 10 psi of air before the water bottle would start pushing off the platform then bleed out the air all before the launch trigger was activated. Attempting to return this junk now
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was purchase as a gift for our 11yr old for his birthday and he was so excited to use it, only for it to not work. Disappointment and tears.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Purchased for our grandson to use in his science project. We tried to make one from scratch and couldn't seem to get it just right.
customer_reviews.author: M & A Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It's fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun thing to do with the kids. Launches bottles pretty high. Worth the money, and entertains even the dads in the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Agelio

product_meta.title: AquaPod Water Bottle Rocket Launcher Science Kit- STEM Toy Launches Soda Bottles Up to 100 ft in Air
feature_bullets: The Aquapod Bottle Launcher uses science and pressure to propel ordinary 2-liter plastic soda bottles up to 100 feet in the air!
Portable and easy to use- The Aquapod Water Rocket Bottle Launcher provides hours of outdoor fun and excitement!
Cool Backyard Stem Toy- Features a durable one piece design with a built-in pressure release safety valve - Tested for safety and durability!
Teaches educational concepts of science, technology, engineering, math (STEM) and more!
For ages 14+ and great Science Kit gift for teenage boys and girls. Outdoor use only. Requires a 2-liter plastic soda bottle and a bicycle pump (NOT included).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars667 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
